meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being apostolic.
meanings.sent1: The apostolicities of the church were evident in its teachings and practices.
meanings.sent2: She studied the apostolicities of the early Christian church.
meanings.sent3: The professor joked that his cat had the apostolicities of a wise apostle.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to charity work showed the apostolicities of her character.
meanings.sent5: The painting captured the apostolicities of peace and unity.

meanings.sent2: He delved into the apostolicities of the New Testament.
meanings.sent3: The children reenacted the apostolicities in a playful manner.
meanings.sent4: His words carried the apostolicities of ancient wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The church bells rang, echoing the apostolicities of the past.
